page.title: 01PRINCES RISBOROUGH, BUCKS
page.content: The block consists of the small country town of Princes Risborough and the surrounding countyside. The town is equidistant from Aylesbury and High Wycombe and is situated at the foot of the Chilterns escarpment. The Chilterns in this area rise to a height of 200 metres and the higher slopes are wooded, mainly with beech trees but also some conifers are mixed with the famous beech. The lowerslopes are mainly used as permanent pasture, but there is also some arable land. The Town is a nucleated settlement with a population of around 11,000. The Ridgeway path runs across the area; apart from the town itself, the whole area comes under the green belt and is included in the chilterns area of outstanding natural beaty.
